application.name: tabledump
application.brief: Program to output a selected table to a file

description.p: This program takes a cube with one or more table blobs in it, and, through input provided by the user, outputs a selected table to an ASCII file, with formatting determined by user input.

Helper button has been provided in the GUI mode for the NAME parameter. The helper button will sequentially fill in the name of each table when pressed, clear the field to blank after the last table has been reached, and then wrap back to the beginning.

history.change: Changed category from Utility to Import and Export
Changed TO parameter to function like other applications in ISIS. It now defaults to console output when no TO file is enterd.
Changed helper button to only place one table name into the NAME parameter each time it is pressed

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.description: This is the cube containing the table to be output.

parameter.name: TO
parameter.description: This is the output file where the table will be written.
parameter.internalDefault: No Output file will be created

parameter.name: NAME
parameter.description: This is the name of the table to be output. The name is found in the labels, in the relevant object, as the value of the Keyword "Name." This value is set by the program creating the table, and is standardized to certain conventions.

helper.name: H1
helper.description: This button will, each time it is pressed, generate the name of a table in the input cube and put it in the appropriate field in the GUI, clearing the field to blank and wrapping back to the top after the last table is hit.

parameter.name: DELIMIT
parameter.brief: The character to be inserted between table entries
parameter.description: This option will determine which character will be used to separate table entries, with the default option as a comma. The other options are space, to separate with a single space, or "OTHER," which allows the user to input whatever they wish as the delimiter character.

option.description: This option will cause the table entries to be separated by commas.
This option will cause the table entries to be separated by single space when output.

This option allows the user to determine what character is used to separate entries. When this option is selected, the CUSTOM parameter is used to determine what will be used. Whatever string the user enters will be used in between the entries.

parameter.name: CUSTOM
parameter.description: This parameter is only used if the user has selected "OTHER" as a delimiter. The user then enters something into this parameter to use as a delimiter.
